reviews.review: One of the best games I've ever played (you should agree)

I must say it is a pretty good game for the creation of the year, I played it and it has a great story too. It is a must buy game for any type of players and is extremely worth the price. Og game for the 20'.

This game is very good challenging, interesting story, great mechanics. Almost what one would want in a story mode game. This is an evergreen game series. Though you can't explore a lot as it is not much of an open-world but yes the story does the talking more.
la segunda entrega de una grandiosa saga, total mente recomendable

Cool game at their time, even today. This game should be mandatory to have it in inventory. Just kidding.  Buy it when on sale, and play it. Worth it to play one legend of FPS PC Game. But don't touch this if you haven't played first HALF LIFE yet. This is history in PC games.
This is one of the best campaigns ever made, just buy it it's worth your time.
Today was the first time I was killed by the garage door near the lighthouse. Wow! This game makes me surprised after 15+ walkthroughs.
Cool story, not that hard so far. I see why it's so popular.
Best fps game I've ever played oh and STILL WAITING FOR HALF LIFE 3 VALVE -_-

As an Xbox gamer of over 20 years, I'm angry that I had this dusty ol laptop since 2014 and never player HL. There's no such thing as a 10/10 game but HL2 deserves nothing less than a 9/10 rating. And at its current price, well let me put it to you this way; 2 Dave's Doubles from Wendy's is over $11, so $10 for this is a score in my humble opinion.

I think many ppl can agree with me on the fact that this game is amazing.
Plus Half life 2 mods are hella fun! 
The Half Life community is one of my favorites out there to ever exist <3 It's so unique and weird at the same time that makes me feel like I'm at home. Also, I'm impressed that this community is still alive.

If the developers would read the comment (which I HIGHLY doubt) I just wanted you to know that this is truly a masterpiece you can/should be proud of! You brought many ppl out there joy and lots of laughters :)

Wow no wonder this game is a classic. Too bad we'll never get half life 3.

Plot: Captivating. Usually I hate the silent protagonist types but I actually enjoyed how they told the story. but I liked the characters, especially the vortiguants. The plot itself is pretty straightforward but had enough mystery to keep pushing me to keep playing while the ending made me wish half life 3 would happen. Even after I was finished I still wanted to learn more about the lore and how some situations came to be. 

Art style: For a game made in 2004 it actually holds up very well visually. Each level is distinct and has it's own atmosphere. No two levels felt even remotely similar, even when you go back to the citadel towards the end. I especially like the design of the poison headcrab, looking almost eerily sinister in the way it stalks you like a tarantula looking for prey.

Gameplay: For 2004? unbelieavbly great and fun. The level design, environmental factors, weapon sandbox, enemy A.I. and game physics are ALL amazing. Each weapon has a pro/con depending on which enemy you're dealing with and at what distance. Don't even get me started on how much fun I had with the gravity gun. 

Sound design/OST: One of the best sci-fi game soundtracks I've heard since Halo. Action music? check. Horror/suspense music? check. Sci-fi trippy music? check. Marty O'Donnell would be proud of the composer's work. 

I can easily see how the HL series was the foundation of countless other video games.
